thread.title: Chinese aggression sends India packing
thread.title_full: Chinese aggression sends India packing - The Times of India

author: Amit Sampat
title: Chinese aggression sends India packing
text:
NAGPUR: Hosts China were efficient at both ends of the court in their 104-58 quarterfinal win over India in the 28th Fiba Asia Basketball Championship at Changsha Hunan on Thursday.
China didn't waste much time in establishing their superiority in this encounter as they had built a 12-point (27-15) lead by the end of the first quarter and never looked back, going up by as many as 48 points in the contest.
Tallest Chinese center Yi Jianlian scored 18 of his 21 points in the first half, as the home team made light work of the slow Indian defence to remain unbeaten in the tournament. In his 23-minute presence, unstoppable Yi made 7 of his 9 attempts from the field including three thunderous dunks and four free throws before being benched for the remainder of the contest.
China continued their dominance in the second period by winning the same 29-14 to stretch the lead further to 27 points at the breather. As compared to the Indian cagers, China carried too many weapons, including those that came off the bench that contributed 22 points before the break.
Indian cagers defended well after the change of ends as the low scoring third quarter saw China winning it 19-11. Continuing their attacking play China took the last period 29-18 to register a facile 46-point victory and seal the semifinal berth.
India skipper Vishesh Bhriguvanshi, once again made his presence felt with a game-high score of 22 points and five assists as the other big men Amjyot Singh and Amrit Pal Singh failed to deliver against a closely guarded Chinese wall. Both the lanky Indian forwards netted as low as five identical points. With the Chinese keeping their focus mainly on the inform duo of Amjyot and Amrit, veteran Indian guard Yadwinder Singh added valuable 16 points and pulled 5 rebounds as others failed.
Having reached the quarterfinals after a 12-year wait, Indian players did earn the respect of their opponents and will now eye the 5th spot in Asia. In their classification games for the 5-8 places, India will take on Korea on Friday.
